description: ENISA Eavesdropping, Interception, or Hijacking (EEIH) - Threats that relay on alters of communication between two parties.

values.description: Threat of disclosure transmitted information using interception and analysis of compromising emission.

Threat of interception of information improperly secured in transmission or improperly actions of staff. Corporate Espionage. Nation state espionage. Information leakage due to unsecured Wi-Fi, rogue access points.
Threat of failure of IT hardware or transmission connection due to electromagnetic induction or electromagnetic radiation emitted from an another source.
Threat in which valid data transmission is maliciously or fraudulently repeated or delayed.
Threat of identifying information about network to find security weaknesses.
values.value: EEIH 6 - Network Reconnaissance, Network Traffic Manipulation, and Information Gathering

values.description: Threats that relay on alters of communication between two parties.
Threat of locating and possible exploite connection to the wireless network.
